name: the one where Kelly tries to register a new owner using the Web form with invalid data
scenarioId: classpath:features/owners/owners_registration:the one where Kelly tries to register a new owner using the Web form with invalid data
methodName: the one where Kelly tries to register a new owner using the Web form with invalid data

testSteps.description: Given Kelly wants to register a new owner using the web application

children.description: Kelly navigates to the owner registration page
Kelly navigates to the welcome page
Kelly opens the browser at http://localhost:32770

rootCause.message:
After several attempts, could not instantiate new WebDriver instance of type class org.openqa.selenium.chrome.ChromeDriver (Could not start a new session. Response code 500. Message: session not created: Chrome failed to start: exited normally.
  (session not created: DevToolsActivePort file doesn't exist)
  (The process started from chrome location /usr/bin/google-chrome is no longer running, so ChromeDriver is assuming that Chrome has crashed.) 
Host info: host: 'fv-az914-180', ip: '10.1.0.220'
Build info: version: '4.23.1', revision: '656257d8e9'
System info: os.name: 'Linux', os.arch: 'amd64', os.version: '6.8.0-1014-azure', java.version: '21.0.4'
Driver info: org.openqa.selenium.chrome.ChromeDriver
Command: [null, newSession {capabilities=[Capabilities {acceptInsecureCerts: true, browserName: chrome, goog:chromeOptions: {args: [no-sandbox, incognito, disable-default-apps, disable-gpu, disable-extensions, window-size=1920,1080, no-sandbox, incognito, disable-default-apps, disable-gpu, disable-extensions, window-size=1920,1080, remote-allow-origins=*], binary: /usr/bin/google-chrome, excludeSwitches: [enable-automation, disable-popup-blocking], extensions: []}}]}]). See below for more details.

Could not start a new session. Response code 500. Message: session not created: Chrome failed to start: exited normally.
  (session not created: DevToolsActivePort file doesn't exist)
  (The process started from chrome location /usr/bin/google-chrome is no longer running, so ChromeDriver is assuming that Chrome has crashed.)

children.description: Kelly clicks on the Owners menu

When she fills the registration form with the following information
| firstName | lastName | address | city | phone |
| [blank] | [blank] | [blank] | [blank] | abc |
Kelly registers a new Owner using the web form
Kelly enters '  ' into the 'firstName' input field
Kelly enters '  ' into the 'lastName' input field
Kelly enters '  ' into the 'address' input field
Kelly enters '  ' into the 'city' input field
Kelly enters 'abc' into the 'telephone' input field
Kelly clicks on the Submit button
Then she should see an alert containing the following error

reportData.title: Expected alert message
reportData.contents:
Bad Request
address: must not be empty
city: must not be empty
firstName: must not be empty
lastName: must not be empty
telephone: numeric value out of bounds

children.description: For Kelly: Then the content of visible alert should contain all the invalid fields

userStory.storyName: The Pet Clinic should allow to register a pet owner in the system
userStory.displayName: The Pet Clinic should allow to register a pet owner in the system
userStory.narrative:
As a VetClinic Manager
  I would like to be able to register a new owner in the system
  In order to handle all the pets and visits made by him

title: the one where Kelly tries to register a new owner using the Web form with invalid data

rule.name: New owners must be registered using a full personal information
rule.description: the mandatory fields are: firstname, lastname, address, city and telephone

testFailureCause.message:
The following 2 assertions failed:
1) Could not instantiate class org.openqa.selenium.chrome.ChromeDriver
2) Expected: a string containing "Bad Request\naddress: must not be empty\ncity: must not be empty\nfirstName: must not be empty\nlastName: must not be empty\ntelephone: numeric value out of bounds" ignoring case
     but: was ""
